items.title: Ixigo – What next after a blockbuster quarter?
items.description: Travel market growth, customer stickiness and value-added offerings augur well for the company

items.title: Chart of the Day: BHEL’s record order book faces a moment of reckoning
items.description: The company saw record order inflows for second consecutive year in FY25

items.title: ITC Hotels: Strong Q4; robust growth outlook
items.description: ITC Hotels has a healthy inventory addition pipeline and there is scope for further sweating the current asset portfolio

items.title: Zydus Lifesciences Q4 net profit rises 18% on strong US, India sales
items.description: Consolidated revenue from operations rose 18% YoY  to Rs 6528 crore, while EBITDA surged 30% to Rs 2,126 crore, with margins expanding 310 basis points to 32.6%.

items.title: Zydus targets FY26 expansion, but warns of slower US momentum post-Revlimid peak
items.description: The US business, a significant contributor to its revenue, is projected for single-digit growth in FY26.

items.title: UGRO Capital board okays Rs 1,314 cr fund raise via rights issue, unsecured compulsorily convertible debentures
items.description: The board has also approved to increase authorized share capital to Rs 270 crore, from Rs 215 crore

items.title: Max Healthcare Q4FY25 net profit rises 21% on higher patient volumes; expansion plans in focus
items.description: The company announced strategic expansion initiatives to bolster its pan-India presence including plans to add 1,500 beds in FY26 through brownfield expansions at Saket, Nanavati, and Mohali hospitals.

items.title: IHH’s NTK ups damages claim against Daiichi Sankyo to Rs 11,800 crore in Fortis deal dispute
items.description: The revised claim stems from NTK’s allegations that Daiichi Sankyo obstructed its 2018 open offer to acquire shares in India’s Fortis Healthcare and its subsidiary Fortis Malar Hospitals.

items.title: Aster DM Healthcare Q4 net profit jumps 21% on margin gains; merger with Quality Care advances
items.description: Revenue for Q4 FY25 rose 2% YoY to Rs 1,000 crore, while operating EBITDA grew 16% to Rs 193 crore.

items.title: Gland Pharma Q4 net profit slips 3% as US sales moderate; focus shifts to complex injectables, CDMO growth
items.description: “FY25 was a year of strategic realignment and investment in future growth,” said Executive Chairman Srinivas Sadu.
